Arctium lappa, Lappa officinalis,, Burdo.pali_sanskrit: Sanskrit: Sarpakshi  The prickly heads of these plants (burrs) easily attach to fur and clothing, forming a method of efficient seed dispersal. The prickly heads inspired the creation of the "Velcro" attaching system. The roots and even leaves are claimed to have medicinal uses (diuretic, control of excessive perspiration, and also claimed to be  "blood purifying" agent although these calims are not based on good clinical trials).
